chinese: 1) [C, U] (AmE) a ceremony at which university, college, or high school students receive their diplomas（大学或高中的）毕业典礼
examples: e.g. The high school [[commencement]] speaker was giving a rather inspiring address.；e.g. Would passengers please turn off their mobile phones before the [[commencement]] of the flight?

chinese: 2) [U] the beginning of sth. 开始；开端
examples: e.g. The high school [[commencement]] speaker was giving a rather inspiring address.；e.g. Would passengers please turn off their mobile phones before the [[commencement]] of the flight?

chinese: 1) [C, U] (AmE) all the teachers in a university （大学的）全体教员
examples: e.g. A drop in enrollment (招生人数) will affect students, [[faculty]], and administrators.；e.g. These plans were part of a reorganization that divided the university into six [[faculties]].

chinese: 2) [C] a department or group of related departments within a university 系；部；院
examples: e.g. A drop in enrollment (招生人数) will affect students, [[faculty]], and administrators.；e.g. These plans were part of a reorganization that divided the university into six [[faculties]].

chinese: 1) deal with a problem or difficult situation 处理，解决（问题或困境）
examples: e.g. You must [[confront]] your fears and doubts and take risks again and again.；e.g. Here are some problems that have [[confronted]] scientists all over the world in the past decade.

chinese: 2) (of a problem or difficult situation) appear and need to be dealt with by sb. （问题或困境）临到···头上；使面对
examples: e.g. You must [[confront]] your fears and doubts and take risks again and again.；e.g. Here are some problems that have [[confronted]] scientists all over the world in the past decade.

chinese: [C] (infml.) sb. who does not have the determination or courage to finish sth. that is difficult 遇到困难就放弃的人；半途而废的人
examples: e.g. I have asked you to do this tough task because I know you are not a [[quitter]].

chinese: not very good 不太好的
examples: e.g. Tourists crowd the gift shops along the street to buy [[mediocre]] products at high prices.

chinese: done too quickly and carelessly — used to show disapproval 马虎的，随便的，草率的（含贬义）
examples: e.g. She complained that the research project was delayed mainly due to [[slipshod]] management.

chinese: willing to forgive 宽容的；宽大的
examples: e.g. The public was more [[forgiving]] of the president's mistakes than the press and fellow politicians.

chinese: [C] a date or time by which you have to do or complete sth. 截止时间；最后期限
examples: e.g. Without extra help, it's going to be very difficult for us to meet the Friday [[deadline]].

chinese: talking too much, esp. about unimportant things （尤指对琐事）喋喋不休的，饶舌的
examples: e.g. I had talked too much about myself and felt like a [[garrulous]] old fool.

chinese: throw sth., esp. sth. light, with a quick gentle movement of your hand 扔，掷，抛（尤指轻的东西）
examples: e.g. She picked up the package and casually [[tossed]] it into her handbag.

chinese: 1) slow in understanding; stupid 迟钝的；愚笨的
examples: e.g. It's such a simple question. If you don't understand then you are [[duller]] than I thought.；e.g. The documentary lasts for more than two-and-a-half hours, and there is scarcely a [[dull]] minute.

chinese: 2) not interesting or exciting 无趣味的；不刺激的；不生动的
examples: e.g. It's such a simple question. If you don't understand then you are [[duller]] than I thought.；e.g. The documentary lasts for more than two-and-a-half hours, and there is scarcely a [[dull]] minute.

chinese: not new, original, or clever; not showing any imagination 无创意的；缺乏想象力的
examples: e.g. He simply couldn't understand why she thought him to be a stiff and [[unimaginative]] person.

chinese: [C, U] an exciting and unusual experience or situation that you imagine happening to you, but which will probably never happen 幻想；想象
examples: e.g. Young children sometimes cannot distinguish between [[fantasy]] and reality.

chinese: [U, sing.] (BrE pretence) a way of behaving which is intended to make people believe sth. that is not true 假装；作假；做作
examples: e.g. Now that the [[pretense]] was over, he could tell them what he really thought.

chinese: (usu. before noun) following what is traditional or the way sth. has been done for a long time 依照传统的；符合习俗的
examples: e.g. It's not a hotel, in the [[conventional]] sense, but rather a whole village turned into a hotel.

chinese: have a bad effect on sth. so that it is no longer attractive, enjoyable, useful, etc. 毁掉；糟蹋；破坏
examples: e.g. They had an entire week, so there was no need to rush into a conversation that might [[spoil]] everything.

chinese: (~ sb. of sth.) prevent sb. from having sth., esp. sth. that they need or should have 剥夺
examples: e.g. Some people worry that the advances in information technology may [[deprive]] citizens of their privacy.

chinese: enough in quantity or of a good enough quality for a particular purpose 足够的；充分的；合乎需要的
examples: e.g. The lunchtime menu is more than [[adequate]] to satisfy the biggest appetite.

chinese: 1) helpful; making sure that people have what they need 关心的；肯帮忙的
examples: e.g. It is an excellent childcare center for babies as the staff are friendly, relaxed and [[attentive]].；e.g. People who watch news tend to be more [[attentive]] to what is on the screen.

chinese: 2) listening or watching carefully and with interest 注意的；留心的；专心的
examples: e.g. It is an excellent childcare center for babies as the staff are friendly, relaxed and [[attentive]].；e.g. People who watch news tend to be more [[attentive]] to what is on the screen.

chinese: [C] sb. who works with you and has a similar position 同事；同僚
examples: e.g. The manual explains what to do if a [[co-worker]] is injured and in need of medical attention.

chinese: offend sb. by saying or doing sth. they think is rude 侮辱；冒犯
examples: e.g. In some cultures, you [[insult]] your host if you do not accept their offer of food.

chinese: (fml.) in a very bad or dangerous condition 状况极坏的；非常危险的
examples: e.g. Relations between the two countries have been in a [[parlous]] state for some time.

chinese: 1) allow people to do, say, or believe sth. without criticizing or punishing them 容忍；宽容
examples: e.g. According to the spokesperson, the government is not prepared to [[tolerate]] the situation any longer.；e.g. For years the workers have had to [[tolerate]] low wages and terrible working conditions.

chinese: 2) be able to accept sth. unpleasant or difficult, even though you do not like it 忍受；忍耐
examples: e.g. According to the spokesperson, the government is not prepared to [[tolerate]] the situation any longer.；e.g. For years the workers have had to [[tolerate]] low wages and terrible working conditions.

chinese: [C] a young person, usu. between the ages of 12 and 18, who is developing into an adult 青少年（常指12至18岁之间的人）
examples: e.g. We know that [[adolescents]] are neither children nor adults and they have specific developmental needs.

chinese: (infml.) deliberately forget sth. you have learned, in order to change the way you do sth. 设法忘记，抛弃（已学会的东西）
examples: e.g. You must start by [[unlearning]] all the bad habits your previous piano teacher taught you!

chinese: (only before noun) done in order to get ready for sth. 预备的；准备的
examples: e.g. Months of [[preparatory]] work needs to be done before construction work can really begin.

chinese: 1) think carefully about what to say, and say it clearly 仔细思考并明确表达
examples: e.g. She has lots of good ideas, but she has difficulty [[formulating]] them in front of investors.；e.g. The city government is currently [[formulating]] policies on road expansion to solve traffic problems.

chinese: 2) develop sth. such as a plan or a set of rules, and decide all the details of how it will be done 规划；制定；准备
examples: e.g. She has lots of good ideas, but she has difficulty [[formulating]] them in front of investors.；e.g. The city government is currently [[formulating]] policies on road expansion to solve traffic problems.

chinese: allowing people to do, say, or believe what they want without criticizing or punishing them 宽容的；容忍的
examples: e.g. My friends are more [[tolerant]], more willing to accept me for what I am.

chinese: increase sth. such as your knowledge, experience, or range of activities 增长（知识、经验等）；扩大（活动范围等）
examples: e.g. The course helps school-leavers [[broaden]] their knowledge of the world of work.

chinese: used when saying what many people say or believe is true, esp. when you disagree with them 据说；据称；一般相信；一般看来
examples: e.g. He was [[supposedly]] delivering some papers to her but I think it was just an excuse to see her.

chinese: 1) remove sth. completely 清除；消除；消灭
examples: e.g. Mr. Woods wants a convincing victory to [[erase]] doubts about his team's ability.；e.g. It appears the names were accidentally [[erased]] from the computer hard drive.

chinese: 2) remove information from a computer memory or recorded sounds from a tape 删除（计算机文件）；抹去（磁带录音）
examples: e.g. Mr. Woods wants a convincing victory to [[erase]] doubts about his team's ability.；e.g. It appears the names were accidentally [[erased]] from the computer hard drive.

chinese: [C] one of the two periods of time that a year at high schools and universities is divided into, esp. in the US（尤指美国中学和大学的）一学期，半学年
examples: e.g. I was finishing my last [[semester]] in college and trying to look for a job in my hometown.

chinese: 1) [C] (AmE) a test that students take in the middle of a semester or quarter 期中考试2) [U] the middle period of an elected government's time in power （政府任期的）中期
examples: e.g. A commitment to making reforms to the care system will form part of tomorrow's [[midterm]] progress report.

chinese: 1) (AmE) an important test that you take at the end of a particular class in high school or college（高中或大学的）期终考试
examples: e.g. He's through to the men's tennis [[final]] for the first time in his career.

chinese: 2) the last and most important game, race, or set of games in a competition 决赛
examples: e.g. He's through to the men's tennis [[final]] for the first time in his career.

chinese: (not before noun) expected to happen or arrive at a particular time 预定的；预期发生（到达）的
examples: e.g. They suddenly gave up the deal the day before they were [[due]] to sign the contract.

chinese: leave a school or university before your course has finished 退学；辍学
examples: e.g. To everyone's surprise, Bill [[dropped]] out of college after his first year and joined a rock-and-roll band.

chinese: think about sth. that happened in the past 回忆起；回顾
examples: e.g. When you [[look]] back on this experience in a year or two, it won't seem so bad.

chinese: what is easiest in a difficult situation 省事的做法
examples: e.g. It is the easy way out to blame others for our failure though it doesn't make any sense.

chinese: express your feelings about sth. through your behavior or actions, esp. when you have been feeling angry or nervous 用行动来表现情绪（尤指愤怒或紧张）
examples: e.g. These teenagers are likely to [[act]] out their feelings of insecurity by being moody and aggressive.

chinese: have taken action so that sb. / sth. is no longer there to worry or annoy you 摆脱某人 / 某事物
examples: e.g. He found his job tedious and time-consuming and he was glad to [[be]] [[rid]] of it.

chinese: suddenly think of sth. 突然冒出（想到）
examples: e.g. List the product's strengths as well as weaknesses at random as they [[pop]] into your mind.

chinese: not to be caught or punished when you have done sth. wrong （做错事）不被发现，不受惩罚
examples: e.g. It's time they put a stop to his bad behavior. He's been [[getting]] away with it for too long.

chinese: start to direct your efforts and attention to sth., esp. work 开始认真对待；开始努力做
examples: e.g. That's a tourism hotspot. I must [[get]] down to booking the hotel as soon as possible.

chinese: not at all 绝不；一点都不
examples: e.g. It is by no means clear where the money is going to come from to fund this project.

chinese: (Brown University) 布朗大学（美国大学，位于罗得岛州）
卡特 • A. 丹尼尔（人名）
罗格斯大学（美国大学，位于新泽西州）
